spec.name: Omar Ibn Abdelaziz School (Prev. German Consulate)
spec.description: This building is a historically complex structure dating from the **19th century**. It originally served as the **Belgian Consulate** before being donated by the Sultan to the German government to establish the **German Consulate** (replacing a previous location). Following Moroccan independence, the building was repurposed as an educational institution and renamed after the revered Umayyad Caliph, **Omar Ibn Abdelaziz**. The building is a rare example of pre-Protectorate diplomatic and commercial architecture near the Old Medina and now functions as a school.

people.comment: Revered Umayyad Caliph after whom the school is named.
The Sultan donated the building to the German government for their consulate.
